page.title: 10TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content: This telephone exchange serves an area 10 kilometres by 10 kilometres around Carnon Downs with 4,000 tele- phone users. It became an automatic exchange in 1921. Before that there was a switchboard and manual operators connecting 2,000 telephones but now only one man is needed to work at the exchange. In 15 years time the service will be run by micro chips and this small exchange will be closed.The most recent extension to enlarge the ex- change cost 250,000. The price of one telephone call now from a public phone box is 10p for 2 minutes if it is a local call and 5p from a private home but at home you have to pay Â£94 a year rent. The cost of a 2 min call to London from a call box is about Â£1.30 at peak time which is during weekday mornings. The Exchange is at Carnon Downs.
